TopicTitle: What didn't you do in KSP today?

Articles.Content: As opposed to the other thread, "What did you do in KSP today", this is a thread for all the things that you were planning to do but either didn't have time to do, or just messed up.
anything, my save file is broke or something and I'm bummed out now.
i havent played since march. been waiting for .24
Wanted to expand ze Mun base, but my tennis classes got in the way.
Play KSP...
I managed to not give KSP Interstellar another (third) attempt.
I tried to land a science module at my Minmus base, and instead it landed on my crew quarters, killing 3 kerbals. I reverted the flight. Waste of an hour

I didn't get anything into kerbins orbit.....getting to grips with a lot of realism overhaul mods.

The moon "MUN" seems lightyears away at this stage. Although I guess the idea of these mods is to generally throw you back into the 1940's and work your way through from there....kind of.

Laythe cargo run went fine, but

today I didn't accomplish a proper Duna cargo run, with my 40 ton test payload.

I made it back to orbit, but was about 150 Delta-V short of completing the transfer.

I added moar fuel now...

Edited June 21, 2014 by Overfloater

Playing KSP. I'm waiting for the new patch and the waiting really sucks this time.

I have a highly modded game and am stuck because I can't land in the desert without a crash. No trip around Kerbin.

So I rage quitted after the 5th try and never played since.
Waiting for 0.24
I still did not complete the Jool-5 mission yet, but have been working on it...

I have been designing a ship capable of reaching Jool using a nuclear reactor, Its too complicated that i halted the development of some models... And i haven't played just for that (And a new unknown kraken causing mod combination).

I didn't rescue this guy. He's been orbiting Minmus for ages now, like some kind of one man space station.

I also didn't get a heavy load into orbit due to glitches. So frustrating. Ended up hyperediting, to achieve what should've been possible.

Edited June 21, 2014 by Tw1
Didn't figure out how to get a VTOL up and flying.

Didn't:

  1. Type-up the last chapter of my tutorial
  2. Get on with Kerbal Text Program IF I'm writing
  3. Receive clue 7 for the Kerbal Amazing Race challenge
  4. Grit my teeth and sit through the 20-odd minute burn for my Moho tanker

(Did procrastinate by redesigning my standard spacestation for Connected Living Spaces)
I didn't remember to put parachutes on my MÃƒÂ¼nar lander. All that science hit the ocean at about 300m/s.
I didn't finish my next video...yet.
I didn't do anything with rovers, because it's easier and safer to fly from one spot to the next. Because rovers suck.

I haven't gotten my Duna mission out of Kerbin orbit, yet, because I am trying to get it fueled up for the trip after getting it into orbit. Refueling missions are turning into my nemesis. My last run I screwed up the timing of the launch, and ended up using half the tanker's own dV making rendezvous. Managed to fill 1.5 large silver Rockomax cans.

Here are the thing's I've planned but haven't done yet.

1: Start a Jool-5

2: Go to KSC2 *Finished!*

3: Retry that Duna flight.

4: Colonize The Mun (or at least Antartica, I have a plan to patch up the ozone hole with boosters.)

Edited June 23, 2014 by ExplodingRocketShips
I didn't do anything fun in KSP today because I was wasting time wrestling with space rocks. Screw asteroids, man.

Fly my SSTO, after 2-3 hours of build the save file bugs. I noticed I suddenly had double the part count and the entire ship is flashing to show overlaps everywhere

Only entertainment was hitting the launch to find half the plane buried in the runway and when the physics kick in parts just starting raining out of the tarmac Ah well. Time to start over again on that build.

Save my Kerbal who is stranded on Eve.

Or do anything...
Anything. I'll fix that soon... I think...
